title: Dialogflow - Events
abstract:
# Dialogflow - Events
Intents are normally matched when an end-user expression matches an intent training phrase. However, you can also trigger intents using . Events can be invoked in many ways.
There are two types of events:
- [Platform events](/dialogflow/docs/events-platform) : These built-in events are provided by platform [integrations](/dialogflow/docs/integrations) . They are invoked when platform-specific events occur. For example, the`FACEBOOK_LOCATION`event is invoked by the Facebook integration when an end-user accepts or rejects a request for the end-user's location.
- [Custom events](/dialogflow/docs/events-custom) : These are events that you define. You can invoke these events using either [fulfillment](/dialogflow/docs/fulfillment-overview) or [the API](/dialogflow/docs/api-overview) . For example, you might set a timed alert during a conversation, which invokes an event at a certain time. This event could trigger an intent that alerts the end-user about something.
content:
## Configure an intent for events
Events are identified simply by their name. Platform-specific events have specific names, but you can name custom events anything.
To configure an intent so that it is triggered when certain events are invoked:
- Go to the [Dialogflow ES Console](https://dialogflow.cloud.google.com) .
- Select an agent.
- Select **Intents** in the left sidebar menu.
- Select an intent.
- Expand thesection.
- Enter one or more event names.
To update intent events with the API, see the [Intents](/dialogflow/docs/reference/common-types#intents) type.
## Event parameters
When invoked, events may also have parameter data that you can access in the triggered intent's responses. For more information, see [Parameter reference for an event parameter](/dialogflow/docs/intents-actions-parameters#event) .
